{{knowledge objective

|Item_parent_short=Rare diseases
|Rank=A
|Title=Knowing the definition of a rare disease
|Description=A rare disease has a prevalence of < 1/2000. 80% of rare diseases are genetic in origin.
|Rubric=Definition
|Contributors=Sylvie Odent
|Order=1}}

Rare disease: a disease that affects less than one person in 2,000 in the general population (definition from the European Regulation on Orphan Medicinal Products).

question.question: What is a rare disease?
question.option_a: A disease that affects more than 2,000 people in the general population.
question.option_b: A disease that affects less than 1/2000 people in the general population.
question.option_c: A disease that is caused by a viral infection.
question.option_d: A disease that is caused by a bacterial infection.
